segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘perfection’.
“Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion

segments.pli: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
segments.en: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this perfection?”

segments.pli: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
“Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
“Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo, ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
segments.en: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this perfection.”

segments.pli: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this perfection.
Just this much is enough to be diligent.”

sections.title: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘perfection’.…

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Jambukhādaka asks Sāriputta about perfection (arahantship) and the path to realize it.
